io.fire.core.server

Class FireIoServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.fire.core.server.FireIoServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PoolHolder

    public class FireIoServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements PoolHolder

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FireIoServer(int port)
      Main FireIoServer function This sets up and starts a server at any given port that is not already in use.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FireIoServer broadcast(java.lang.String channel, Packet packet)
      Broadcast a packet over a channel.
      FireIoServer broadcast(java.lang.String channel, java.lang.String message)
      Broadcast a message (String) over a channel.
      FireIoServer denyConnection(BlockedProtocol protocol)
      Deny connection is used to BLACKLIST a connection type.
      Client getClient(java.util.UUID id)
      Get a CONNECTED Fire-IO client by UUID
      Client getClientByTag(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Sorts clients and filters for tag, used for getting a specific one when you've got a bunch connected
      java.util.Collection<FireIoConnection> getClients()
      Returns a collection of all READY, CONNECTED and HEALTHY clients
      java.util.List<Client> getClientsByTag(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Get all clients that have a tag with value set used for filtering for types
      ThreadPool getPool()
      get thread pool, for internal usage
      FireIoServer linkLoadBalancer(BalancerConfiguration configuration)
      Connect and setup a loadbalancer, the loadbalancer configuration is your loadbalancer password, host and port you can setup multiple loadbalancers at the same time
      FireIoServer on(Event e, java.util.function.Consumer<EventPayload> r)
      Register an event handler for a specific Event Mostly used for Fire-IO native API
      FireIoServer on(java.lang.String e, java.util.function.Consumer<EventPayload> r)
      Register an event handler for a channel
      FireIoServer onRequest(java.lang.String type, RequestExecutor executor)
      Register a request handler the type is the name of a request, that is used every time you want to trigger your executor.
      FireIoServer registerEndpoint(java.lang.String path, HttpInteraction exchange)
      register HTTP api endpoints String is your path (like /api/v2/get/?name) with ? to assign variables.
      FireIoServer setPassword(java.lang.String password)
      Set a password for the network.
      FireIoServer setRateLimiter(int requests, int timeout)
      set or change the rate limiter settings this overwrites the current or default settings
      FireIoServer setThreadPoolSize(int size)
      set the threadpoolsize, default is 1 threadpools are used to execute tasks like requests and events everything is async.

      • FireIoServer

        public FireIoServer(int port)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Main FireIoServer function This sets up and starts a server at any given port that is not already in use. the server starts immediately after setting up
        Parameters:
        port -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • denyConnection

        public FireIoServer denyConnection(BlockedProtocol protocol)
        Deny connection is used to BLACKLIST a connection type. For instance, to setup a web-server to deny ALL socket connections.
        Parameters:
        protocol -
        Returns:

      • setPassword

        public FireIoServer setPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Set a password for the network. Not set (open) by default. Can also be used to UPDATE the password in a already connected instance. All current clients will remain connected, but new clients will have to use the new password.
        Parameters:
        password -
        Returns:

      • broadcast

        public FireIoServer broadcast(java.lang.String channel,
                              Packet packet)
        Broadcast a packet over a channel. Same effect as sending it to a client, but this targets all clients thay are ready to accept packets.
        Parameters:
        channel -
        packet -
        Returns:

      • setThreadPoolSize

        public FireIoServer setThreadPoolSize(int size)
        set the threadpoolsize, default is 1 threadpools are used to execute tasks like requests and events everything is async. you may find yourself increasing the threadpool if you do stuff like database query's inside of your networking
        Parameters:
        size -
        Returns:

      • onRequest

        public FireIoServer onRequest(java.lang.String type,
                              RequestExecutor executor)
        Register a request handler the type is the name of a request, that is used every time you want to trigger your executor. the executor is where you handle your request and finish it
        Parameters:
        type -
        executor -
        Returns:
